multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the graphics of μ(u) and σα(u) with a1 = 1, a2 = a3 = ∞. What is represented on the y-axis?
This figure illustrates μ(u) and σα(u) with a2 = 1, a1 = a3 = ∞. Compared to Figure 1, what is the main difference observed in the dark matter distribution?
choices: The dark matter density is higher at all distances.
The dark matter density falls off more rapidly with distance.
The dark matter density peaks at a smaller distance.
There is no significant difference in the dark matter distribution.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the rotational velocity curves of galaxies. What do the terms containing 'a1', 'a2', and 'a3' represent?
choices: The contribution of ordinary matter to the gravitational potential.
The effects of dark energy on the galactic rotation.
The modifications to Newtonian gravity due to the proposed model.
The relativistic corrections to the Newtonian gravitational force.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula represents the calculated value of a specific phenomenon. What phenomenon does this formula describe?
choices: Gravitational redshift of light near a massive object
Gravitational lensing of light by the Sun
Time dilation experienced by an object in a gravitational field
